@graph.name: Easy Beef Wellington Recipe for Two - The Cookie Rookie®
@graph.description: This easy beef wellington recipe for two is perfect for a date night or dinner party. Individual beef wellingtons cooked exactly how you like them.

itemListElement.name: Easy Beef Wellington Recipe for Two

@graph.headline: Easy Beef Wellington Recipe for Two

@graph.name: Becky Hardin
@graph.description: Becky woke up on her 30th birthday and realized she didn't know how to cook, ANYTHING! She started The Cookie Rookie as a way to document her journey to learn how to cook, one recipe at a time! The Cookie Rookie is a place to find easy recipes that anyone can make, and everyone will love!

@graph.name: Easy Beef Wellington Recipe
@graph.description: This easy beef wellington recipe for two is perfect for a date night or dinner party. Individual beef wellingtons are perfect to serve as part for a special occasion, and simpler to make than you think! Enjoy this restaurant quality dish at home!
recipeIngredient: 2  8-ounce center-cut filets mignons, 2-inches thick, trimmed of fat

recipeInstructions.text: Adjust oven rack to upper-middle position and heat oven to 400°F, and line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Adjust oven rack to upper-middle position and heat oven to 400°F, and line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.

recipeInstructions.text: Process mushrooms in a food processor until minced, scraping down sides of bowl as needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Process mushrooms in a food processor until minced, scraping down sides of bowl as needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Pat filets dry with paper towels and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Pat filets dry with paper towels and sprinkle with salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil over medium-high heat, in a non-stick skillet. Sear filets 2 minutes per side or until mahogany brown. Transfer the beef to a paper towel-lined plate.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil over medium-high heat, in a non-stick skillet. Sear filets 2 minutes per side or until mahogany brown. Transfer the beef to a paper towel-lined plate.

recipeInstructions.text: Reduce heat to medium and add the minced mushrooms, shallot, garlic, thyme, 1 teaspoon salt, and ¼ teaspoon pepper. Cook, stirring often, until browned and most of the liquid has evaporated, about 6-8 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Reduce heat to medium and add the minced mushrooms, shallot, garlic, thyme, 1 teaspoon salt, and ¼ teaspoon pepper. Cook, stirring often, until browned and most of the liquid has evaporated, about 6-8 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the Madeira and cook about 2 minutes or until all liquid has evaporated. Transfer the mixture to a plate and allow to cool completely.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in the Madeira and cook about 2 minutes or until all liquid has evaporated. Transfer the mixture to a plate and allow to cool completely.

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly flour a clean work surface and roll the puff pastry into an 11-inch square. Cut the pastry into 4 equal squares and transfer 2 of the squares (2 inches apart) on the prepared baking sheet.
recipeInstructions.name: Lightly flour a clean work surface and roll the puff pastry into an 11-inch square. Cut the pastry into 4 equal squares and transfer 2 of the squares (2 inches apart) on the prepared baking sheet.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread ¼ cup mushroom mixture in the center of each square, to about the same diameter of the filets. Be sure to leave a 1-inch border of the puff pastry showing.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread ¼ cup mushroom mixture in the center of each square, to about the same diameter of the filets. Be sure to leave a 1-inch border of the puff pastry showing.

recipeInstructions.text: Set a filet on top of the mushroom mixture in the middle of the two pastry squares.
recipeInstructions.name: Set a filet on top of the mushroom mixture in the middle of the two pastry squares.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread ½ teaspoon mustard over the tops of the filets.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread ½ teaspoon mustard over the tops of the filets.

recipeInstructions.text: Set the 2 remaining pastry squares over the filets and stretch the top pastry squares to meet the bottom pastry squares. Gently press the pastry around the filets to form a tight pastry pocket/shape.
recipeInstructions.name: Set the 2 remaining pastry squares over the filets and stretch the top pastry squares to meet the bottom pastry squares. Gently press the pastry around the filets to form a tight pastry pocket/shape.

recipeInstructions.text: Pinch the top and bottom together.
recipeInstructions.name: Pinch the top and bottom together.

recipeInstructions.text: Trim excess pastry around the filets, leaving 1/2 –inch border around all around.
recipeInstructions.name: Trim excess pastry around the filets, leaving 1/2 –inch border around all around.

recipeInstructions.text: Crimp the dough around the edge being sure to securely seal the filet packets.
recipeInstructions.name: Crimp the dough around the edge being sure to securely seal the filet packets.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the pastry packets in the fridge, uncovered for 30-60 minutes or until cold. Do NOT leave the packets longer than 1 hour or the pastry will get soggy.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the pastry packets in the fridge, uncovered for 30-60 minutes or until cold. Do NOT leave the packets longer than 1 hour or the pastry will get soggy.

recipeInstructions.text: When the packets are cold, brush the tops and sides with the beaten egg, and sprinkle the tops with flake sea salt.
recipeInstructions.name: When the packets are cold, brush the tops and sides with the beaten egg, and sprinkle the tops with flake sea salt.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake 18-25 minutes or until meat registers 110°F-120°F (depending on how you like your steaks).
recipeInstructions.name: Bake 18-25 minutes or until meat registers 110°F-120°F (depending on how you like your steaks).

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer Beef Wellington to a wire rack to rest.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer Beef Wellington to a wire rack to rest.

recipeInstructions.text: **For steaks medium-rare, cook the meat to 110°F and let rest 10 minutes. For steaks cooked to medium, cook the meat to 110°F and let rest 20 minutes. For steaks cooked medium-well, cook the meat to 120° and let rest 10 minutes. As stated in the Notes sections, the puff pastry packets act as an oven and the meat continues to cook while resting.
recipeInstructions.name: **For steaks medium-rare, cook the meat to 110°F and let rest 10 minutes. For steaks cooked to medium, cook the meat to 110°F and let rest 20 minutes. For steaks cooked medium-well, cook the meat to 120° and let rest 10 minutes. As stated in the Notes sections, the puff pastry packets act as an oven and the meat continues to cook while resting.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the Beef Wellington has rested as desired, serve and…
recipeInstructions.name: Once the Beef Wellington has rested as desired, serve and…

recipeInstructions.text: Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Enjoy!

@graph.keywords: beef wellington for two, easy beef wellington recipe, individual beef wellingtons
